com.safety4kids.game.Utils

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.safety4kids.game.Utils.InputHandler

  • public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class allows you create an instance of an InputHandler object, which allows the program to accept inputs to alter a MainPlayer object's state, which consists of it's location on the map.
    Author:
    Erfan Yeganehfar, Bill Bai

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static MainPlayer player
      This is the instance of the MainPlayer object, that will be altered by the InputHandler object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      InputHandler(MainPlayer player)
      Constructor of the class.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      This method processes inputs.
      void moveLeft()

    • Field Detail

      • player

        private static MainPlayer player
        This is the instance of the MainPlayer object, that will be altered by the InputHandler object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputHandler

        public InputHandler(MainPlayer player)
        Constructor of the class. Sets the MainPlayer to be moved, to player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player, which the InputHandler object will alter.

    • Method Detail

      • inputProcess

        public void inputProcess()
        This method processes inputs.
        If the up key or W key is pressed, it will call the MainPlayer object's jump method.
        If the right key or D key is pressed, it will call the moveRight method of this class, which will shift the location of the MainPlayer object right.
        If the left key or A key is pressed, it will call the moveLeft method of this class, which will shift the location of the MainPlayer object left.

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Shifts the location of player to the right

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Shifts the location of player to the left
